title: Cloudflare Access Policies Issues
content:
Jul 7, 20:31 UTC

Monitoring - Cloudflare has implemented a fix for this issue and is currently monitoring the results.

We will update the status once the issue is resolved.

Identified - Cloudflare has identified the issue and is implementing a fix.

We will update the status once we implement the fix.

Investigating - Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Access policies denying users who should be approved.

We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

title: Upcoming Datacenter Upgrades
content:
Jul 2, 13:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Apr 26, 05:01 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Apr 22, 19:29 UTC
Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.

Apr 22, 02:59 UTC
Scheduled - Throughout the months of May and June 2021, we will be performing maintenance on various datacenters. Each window will be between 1am-6am local time of the data center. There is a possibility of a slight increase in latency during these maintenance windows. The most up-to-date schedule can be located here: Planned maintenance for Cloudflare data centers.
contentSnippet:
Jul  2, 13:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Apr 26, 05:01 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Apr 22, 19:29 UTC
Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.
Apr 22, 02:59 UTC
Scheduled - Throughout the months of May and June 2021, we will be performing maintenance on various datacenters. Each window will be between 1am-6am local time of the data center. There is a possibility of a slight increase in latency during these maintenance windows. The most up-to-date schedule can be located here: Planned maintenance for Cloudflare data centers.

title: Retro - Single-File Cache Purge Issues
content:
Jul 1, 22:57 UTC
Resolved - Between June 28th - July 1st, Cloudflare customer's on Free plans may have experienced issues performing a single-file cache purge (purge by URL) called via the Dashboard/API.

We have identified the issue and implemented a fix, resolving the issue.
contentSnippet:
Jul  1, 22:57 UTC
Resolved - Between June 28th - July 1st, Cloudflare customer's on Free plans may have experienced issues performing a single-file cache purge (purge by URL) called via the Dashboard/API. 
We have identified the issue and implemented a fix, resolving the issue.

title: New WAF events logged under wrong category
content:

Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jul 1, 17:54 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jul 1, 16:40 UTC
Update - A fix is now being applied, and customers will start to see the correct value in the log over the next hour.

Jul 1, 14:58 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jul 1, 14:29 UTC
Investigating - Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating an issue which impacts customers using the new managed rules. Log entries on Firewall Events triggered by the Managed Rules are being reported as triggered by "Firewall Rules" instead of "Firewall Managed". No other edge or API impact.

Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Logins are failing with a 404 error.

We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem. More updates to follow shortly.

title: Retro - Elevated number of 504 errors
content:
Jun 29, 19:31 UTC
Resolved - Between 18:00-19:00 UTC customers reaching Newark, NJ would have experienced an elevated number of 504 errors due to congestion.
contentSnippet:
Jun 29, 19:31 UTC
Resolved - Between 18:00-19:00 UTC customers reaching Newark, NJ would have experienced an elevated number of 504 errors due to congestion.

title: Cache Purging Delays
content:
Jun 28, 16:48 UTC
Resolved - The incident has been resolved.

Jun 28, 14:21 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jun 28, 13:44 UTC
Investigating - Cloudflare single-file cache purging (purge by URL) called via the Dashboard/API is running up to 40 minutes behind. This also affects the "Always Online" feature.

We are working to resolve this issue as soon as possible. Until then you may use the Purge Everything feature but do be aware it may cause a surge in traffic to your origin server(s). More updates to follow.
contentSnippet:
Jun 28, 16:48 UTC
Resolved - The incident has been resolved.
Jun 28, 14:21 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Jun 28, 13:44 UTC
Investigating - Cloudflare single-file cache purging (purge by URL) called via the Dashboard/API is running up to 40 minutes behind. This also affects the "Always Online" feature.
We are working to resolve this issue as soon as possible. Until then you may use the Purge Everything feature but do be aware it may cause a surge in traffic to your origin server(s). More updates to follow.
